content.description:
Start with your foot on the low ledge on the south face and with your right hand wherever on the arete. Make a dynamic move up left to a fine-grained, dark gray pinch. Keep tension and work your way up the arete with poor feet on the face and top out the apex of the arete.

Engaging, albeit a bit short.

Not sure if this is already in BB (hence the generic name and lack of FA info) but I thought it was fun enough to make it worth adding to MP.
content.location:
This problem is located on the Bulge boulder and climbs the striking arete on the right side of the boulder’s south face.

If you are approaching from the user-created trail to the south of this cluster, this problem will be hard to miss.

content.description: See Bulge II, this climbs the right side of that face.
The tall chipped arete on the tall boulder.  Chipped and with a bad landing.

Traverse the long gritty lip on the south side of the bulge boulder from left to right. Gets just a touch tricky near the end.

Starting lower on the arete makes it a little more V4.

In the BB as ‘Lip Traverse’, but Mike B was cool with calling it Lipstick. Judging by the trees that were in the way, hasn’t been climbed for many years, but I cleaned it up, so there is plenty of space now
content.protection: A pad toward the end, or a spotter to move it
content.location: On the long south face of the larger boulder west of the Mormon Strikes Again shot hole tower

content.description: This is on the lower boulder.  The first one you see.  It climbs the obvious mellow drilled holes/crack.
In the main groub of boulders, there is an obvious crack.  Tall but easy.

Mike B didn’t think this had been done. Felt like a harder V4. Cleared out some brush and added a fun name.

Start with hands on the south (right) end of the lip, then traverse left topping out at the crack on the north (left) corner.

The horizontal sloper shot holes are actually pretty interesting to work out. Sharp and gritty, and the ending features are pretty cool.
content.protection: If you really want to cover the whole span, 3-4 pads. Landing is a little steep and scrub oak covered
content.location: On the west side of the Bulge boulder next to ‘Mormons Strike Again’.

content.description: This is on the boulder to the west of the boulder with Mormons Strike Again on it.  This climbs the left side of the wall that faces the tall boulder.
The small rock behind the 2 aretes.  The one you would break your back on if you fell of the chipped arete.  It has, on the west side, a bulging slab.  Short.
The arete on the right as you look at the two aretes.  It is the eastmost arete.  It is the safer of the two aretes on the large rock.
